data.title: Dirty! Dirty! Dirty! Most horrific meal ever!!
data.text: How the health board have not closed this horrid place down is beyond me?! Ordered the 'sweet & Sour' chicken. Was given about 5 ROCK HARD over cooked chicken NUGGETS with a horrific red instant sauce over it with rice that had bugs in it!  Took one bite , spat it out . Thank G! Because that was when I noticed 'things' in the rice. Everyone giving 'amazing' remarks here Must be buddies or family? The smell of old oil stuck on my clothes and hair all the way home! Horrid place! I for one will be calling Heath services.

data.title: Nice treat to discover Vietnamese too
data.text: I just did a Siri request for Chinese food and was directed here! Nice efficient staff, many local and repeat customers , and good food. I ordered the spring rolls because 3 people before me did, and was delighted. Thin film wrapped around thin slice of beef on one side,filled with lettuce bean sprouts and vermicelli, and two pick shrimp and green onion . The peanut sauce served with was amazing! I ordered V8, a chicken vegetable dish  with vermicelli , so large I filled a quart container with the portion I couldn't eat. Will come again when in Columbia!

data.title: Pho
data.text: I eat here frequently, the nicest little lady at the counter, always good food, especially the pho and spring rolls.  The Decor is nothing to write home about and I'd not say it was a sterile environment but, it is reasonably priced, really nice people and good food.

data.title: Authentic Asian
data.text: Excellent authentic Vietnamese cooking!  Their ginger and mint Pho soup is fabulous.

data.title: great food
data.text: reasonable prices very good vietnamese menu.  Carry out, owned byt the same family for over 10 years.

data.title: Update - even better!
data.text: No, they haven't changed the furnishings, though they have had someone do very nice Chinese caligraphy-like brush paintings on the walls. They also haven't added paper towels to the bathroom, just installed a rather inefficient blow drier. What has changed since my previous review is that I have branched out to try several different kinds of pho and a number of the other Vietnamese dishes (such as special lo mein loaded with seafood, chicken, and bean sprouts and golden tofu in chili sauce), and I have discovered that everything is delicious, freshly made, and served in extremely generous portions. This has become the place we go to in Columbia for Vietnamese food, which I have to say now is among the best I've ever had.

data.title: Not too bad
data.text: It's very much a budget operation - almost completely undecorated, second-hand restaurant supply furnishings, and never any paper towels in the lone restroom - and it isn't the best Vietnamese food I've ever had. However, it is the only choice for Vietnamese food in Columbia, and it is very reasonably priced. Both the various types of pho and the spring rolls taste good despite using what are pretty clearly the cheapest ingredients they can manage, and you can get a big bowl of soup and two hefty rolls for around $7.00. Do bring cash: they're understandably wary of checks and don't take any cards. Service is generally very fast, even when they're full or have many take-out orders.

data.title: Good food. Low price. Borderline bad atmosphere. Also the only place I know of with Vietnamese cuisine. In fact, that...
data.text: Good food. Low price. Borderline bad atmosphere. Also the only place I know of with Vietnamese cuisine. In fact, that is more of their specialty IMO.

data.title: Chinese Wok Express
data.text: Delicious, hot food and fast service. This food is cooked fresh, not reheated as served. And the eggrolls are homemade/hand rolled - fantastic! Prices are great. Don't come here if you're looking for atmosphere, just great food.
